fields.name: AdministratorLogin
fields.description: Administrator username for the managed instance. Can only be specified when the managed instance is being created (and is required for creation).

fields.name: AdministratorLoginPassword
fields.description: The administrator login password (required for managed instance creation).

fields.name: Administrators
fields.description: The Azure Active Directory administrator of the instance. This can only be used at instance create time. If used for instance update, it will be ignored or it will result in an error. For updates individual APIs will need to be used.

fields.name: Collation
fields.description: Collation of the managed instance.

fields.name: CreateTime
fields.description: Specifies the point in time (ISO8601 format) of the Managed Instance creation.

fields.name: CurrentBackupStorageRedundancy
fields.description: The storage account type used to store backups for this instance. The options are Local (LocallyRedundantStorage), Zone (ZoneRedundantStorage), Geo (GeoRedundantStorage) and GeoZone(GeoZoneRedundantStorage)

fields.name: DnsZone
fields.description: The Dns Zone that the managed instance is in.

fields.name: DnsZonePartner
fields.description: The resource id of another managed instance whose DNS zone this managed instance will share after creation.

fields.name: ExternalGovernanceStatus
fields.description: Status of external governance.

fields.name: FullyQualifiedDomainName
fields.description: The fully qualified domain name of the managed instance.

fields.name: HybridSecondaryUsage
fields.description: Hybrid secondary usage. Possible values are 'Active' (default value) and 'Passive' (customer uses the secondary as Passive DR).

fields.name: HybridSecondaryUsageDetected
fields.description: Hybrid secondary usage detected. Possible values are 'Active' (customer does not meet the requirements to use the secondary as Passive DR) and 'Passive' (customer meets the requirements to use the secondary as Passive DR).

fields.name: InstancePoolId
fields.description: The Id of the instance pool this managed server belongs to.

fields.name: IsGeneralPurposeV2
fields.description: Whether or not this is a GPv2 variant of General Purpose edition.

fields.name: KeyId
fields.description: A CMK URI of the key to use for encryption.

fields.name: LicenseType
fields.description: The license type. Possible values are 'LicenseIncluded' (regular price inclusive of a new SQL license) and 'BasePrice' (discounted AHB price for bringing your own SQL licenses).

fields.name: MaintenanceConfigurationId
fields.description: Specifies maintenance configuration id to apply to this managed instance.

fields.name: ManagedInstanceCreateMode
fields.description:
Specifies the mode of database creation.

Default: Regular instance creation.

Restore: Creates an instance by restoring a set of backups to specific point in time. RestorePointInTime and SourceManagedInstanceId must be specified.

fields.name: MinimalTlsVersion
fields.description: Minimal TLS version. Allowed values: 'None', '1.0', '1.1', '1.2'

fields.name: PricingModel
fields.description: Weather or not Managed Instance is freemium.

fields.name: PrimaryUserAssignedIdentityId
fields.description: The resource id of a user assigned identity to be used by default.

fields.name: PrivateEndpointConnections
fields.description: List of private endpoint connections on a managed instance.

fields.name: ProvisioningState
fields.description: Provisioning state of managed instance.

fields.name: ProxyOverride
fields.description: Connection type used for connecting to the instance.

fields.name: PublicDataEndpointEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not the public data endpoint is enabled.

fields.name: RequestedBackupStorageRedundancy
fields.description: The storage account type to be used to store backups for this instance. The options are Local (LocallyRedundantStorage), Zone (ZoneRedundantStorage), Geo (GeoRedundantStorage) and GeoZone(GeoZoneRedundantStorage)

fields.name: RestorePointInTime
fields.description: Specifies the point in time (ISO8601 format) of the source database that will be restored to create the new database.

fields.name: ServicePrincipal
fields.description: The managed instance's service principal.

fields.name: SourceManagedInstanceId
fields.description: The resource identifier of the source managed instance associated with create operation of this instance.

fields.name: State
fields.description: The state of the managed instance.

fields.name: StorageIOps
fields.description: Storage IOps. Minimum value: 120. Maximum value: 120000. Increments of 1 IOps allowed only. Maximum value depends on the selected hardware family and number of vCores.

fields.name: StorageSizeInGB
fields.description: Storage size in GB. Minimum value: 32. Maximum value: 16384. Increments of 32 GB allowed only. Maximum value depends on the selected hardware family and number of vCores.

fields.name: StorageThroughputMBps
fields.description: Storage throughput in MBps. Minimum value: 25. Maximum value: 4000. Increments of 1 MBps allowed only. Maximum value depends on the selected hardware family and number of vCores.

fields.name: SubnetId
fields.description: Subnet resource ID for the managed instance.

fields.name: TimezoneId
fields.description:
Id of the timezone. Allowed values are timezones supported by Windows.
Windows keeps details on supported timezones, including the id, in registry under
KEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones.
You can get those registry values via SQL Server by querying SELECT name AS timezone_id FROM sys.time_zone_info.
List of Ids can also be obtained by executing [System.TimeZoneInfo]::GetSystemTimeZones() in PowerShell.
An example of valid timezone id is "Pacific Standard Time" or "W. Europe Standard Time".

fields.name: VCores
fields.description: The number of vCores. Allowed values: 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 64, 80.

fields.name: VirtualClusterId
fields.description: Virtual cluster resource id for the Managed Instance.

fields.name: ZoneRedundant
fields.description: Whether or not the multi-az is enabled.
